summary: This document is an email chain between attorney Robert Glassman and others, primarily discussing the scheduling of meetings and investigative steps related to a potential client/witness in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It reveals coordination for interviews and contact with the client's family members.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP representing a client (likely a witness or victim) in the SDNY Epstein investigation. He is coordinating meetings and investigative steps with others.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be involved in the investigation or coordination efforts.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Correspondent (likely from SDNY) scheduling meetings with Robert Glassman and his client, discussing topics for the meeting including travel specifics and conduct by Epstein and/or Maxwell.

connections.description: Attorney coordinating meetings and sharing information with an investigator/prosecutor (Alex) from the SDNY regarding a client/witness in the Epstein investigation.
Colleagues or associates copied on email correspondence regarding the investigation and client coordination.

events.title: Media reports on civil lawsuit filing
events.description: Media reports indicate a civil lawsuit related to the SDNY Epstein investigation was filed, prompting an inquiry to attorney Robert Glassman.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with client
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Monday, December 16, 2019, at 11:00 a.m. at Robert Glassman's office between Glassman, his client, and investigators (Alex et al.) to discuss the SDNY investigation.

keyFacts: Attorney Robert Glassman is representing a client (a female, implied to be a witness or victim) in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
Investigators were planning to contact the client's siblings and mother as potential witnesses, with the mother noted as being overseas and potentially a key witness.
The email chain discusses logistical planning for interviews, including topics like the client's travel and specific conduct by Epstein and/or Maxwell.
A civil lawsuit related to the investigation was reportedly filed in January 2020, catching some parties by surprise based on media reports.
